title: Len Aston
text:
Leonard "Len" Aston (14 June 1920 – 19 November 1987) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>, as a or , i.e. number 3 or 4, 8 or 10, 11 or 12, or 13 during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Aston was born in <a href="Prescot">Prescot</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England.
Playing career.
International honours.
Len Aston won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at St. Helens in 1947 against Wales, and France, in 1948 against France, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at St. Helens in 1947 against New Zealand (3 matches).
Testimonial match.
Len Aston's <a href="testimonial%20match">testimonial match</a> at St. Helens took place against <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> at <a href="Knowsley%20Road">Knowsley Road</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> on Saturday 3 March 1951.
